tool.name: HydroSHEDStoStreamNetwork

param.name: File_GDB_Name
param.dialogReference: The name of the goedatabase that will be created. This is where all of the output files will be sent.

param.name: File_GDB_Location
param.dialogReference: Folder that the new geodatabase will created in.

param.name: Watershed_Boundary
param.dialogReference: A shapefile of the area which area that will be processed. It is important that this area captures the entirety all of the catchments which contribute to the area of interest.

param.name: Number_of_cells_to_define_stream
param.displayname: Number of cells to define stream
param.dialogReference: This is the number of cells to define a stream.

param.name: Output_Coordinate_System
param.dialogReference: The coordinate system which is close in proximity to the desired region

param.name: Input_DEM
param.dialogReference: All of the raster DEM files which cover the desired area. Since DEMs are not refined in this process it is important to use conditioned DEMs

param.name: Watershed_Flow_Direction_Rasters
param.dialogReference: All of the flow direction files which cover the desired area. If flow directions are not provided then they will be generated from the DEM data.

tool.summary: This converts conditioned HydroSHEDS DEM data to drainage network.
tool.usage: This process produces drainagelines, catchments, as well as the files ArcHydro requires such as Cat, Str, StrLink ect. This process does not fill the sinks in DEM data since it is not required for the HydroSHEDS conditioned DEMs.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: This converts conditioned HydroSHEDS DEM data to drainage network.
